alert.note: Alert for Assumption; East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Lower Terrebonne; Northern Livingston; St. Helena; St. James; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 11:40PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong winds assocaited with a large outflow boundary coming from the severe storms earlier to the east will impact portions of western Ascension, west central St. James, West Baton Rouge, southwestern St. Helena, northwestern Terrebonne, northwestern Livingston, southwestern East Feliciana, Iberville, northwestern Lafourche, East Baton Rouge and Assumption Parishes through 1230 AM CDT... At 1138 PM CDT, we have had multiple reporting sistes report wind gusts in excess of 40 mph. This boundary is a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Watson to near Shenandoah to near Geismar to Paincourtville to near Labadieville to near Gray. Movement was west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Houma, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Gonzales, Donaldsonville, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Napoleonville, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Walker, Addis, Brusly, White Castle, Slaughter, Westminster, Schriever and Geismar. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 144 and 180. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 17. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Lower Terrebonne; Northern Livingston; St. Helena; St. James; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension
